reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty-Three, File 17 of 27
title: Cellular Information
historical_context: This article provides a detailed compilation of cellular frequencies and codes relevant to the early days of mobile telecommunications, reflecting the burgeoning interest in cellular technology during the 1990s.
short_summary: The article compiles detailed information on cellular frequencies, channels, and codes used in mobile telecommunications, providing a valuable resource for understanding early cellular technology.
summary:
In 'Cellular Information', Madjus of N.O.D. presents an extensive compilation of cellular frequencies categorized by cell bands, detailing the transmit and receive channels for each. The article serves as a technical reference for those interested in the inner workings of cellular networks, particularly during a time when mobile technology was rapidly evolving. It includes specific channel frequencies for multiple cells, which could be of interest to hackers and telecommunications professionals looking to understand or exploit the infrastructure of cellular communications.

The article also lists SIDH codes for various cities, providing insight into the geographical distribution of cellular services. This information is crucial for anyone looking to navigate the complexities of early mobile networks, whether for legitimate purposes or for exploring the vulnerabilities inherent in the technology. Overall, this piece is a significant contribution to the understanding of cellular technology and its implications for security and privacy.
